last_episode_to_air.name: Sue, Lee & Andy
last_episode_to_air.overview: Self-professed renovation experts Lee and Andy try to give Sebastian a run for his money renovating their mother’s 1970’s style kitchen.

name: Save My Reno
overview: Sebastian Clovis and Sabrina Smelko help save the renovations of people who are in over their head.

episodes.name: Sarah and Jon
episodes.overview: Sarah and Jon bought their first home and knew it needed some fixing up, but didn’t realize how much time and money it would take to get it family friendly. Jon took on the basement reno first and quickly realized the kitchen is beyond his skills.  There’s a lot to deal with, including an odd layout, peel and stick flooring and very shallow counters. Jon’s on paternity leave and needs the job done before he returns to work, but quotes are coming in high. With some unique finds and reimagining standard cabinets Sebastian and Sabrina will get it done and save their reno.

episodes.name: Nick and Zina
episodes.overview: Nick and Zina are a dynamic real estate duo that understands pride of ownership. Their family home is impeccable, except for their master bathroom. The door to this room remains closed and hidden from visitors. It’s very large, very dark, and has some very strange features that leave people scratching their heads. They’ve renovated their whole house, so money is tight.  But quotes they’ve been getting are coming in well above their budget.  They’re at a loss and need help. Sebastian and Sabrina impart their expertise and create break out builds with custom surprises as they save their reno.

episodes.name: David and Wemi
episodes.overview: David and Wemi love their home but hate their builder’s grade galley kitchen. There’s not enough counter space or storage and the layout is tight. They’ve made DIY attempts to add storage and update features, only to admit defeat in their efforts to make the space more functional. But a full kitchen reno is bigger than these DIY’ers can handle. They need the professionals. With a growing baby, money is tight and quotes are coming in higher than they can afford. But Sebastian and Sabrina know how to save their reno through some upcycling tricks and smart spends.

episodes.name: Joel and Kera
episodes.overview: Joel and Kera have two growing boys, a busy schedule, and a basement straight out of the 70s. Kera’s grandmother used to own the house, but now it’s Kera and Joel’s.  Kera has fond memories of family gatherings in the space, and wants to capture those days again with her growing family. But the orange carpet, dark paneling, and damp feel isn’t inviting at all. They’ve reached out to contractors, but quotes are exceeding their budget.  Sebastian and Sabrina will breathe new life into the space through salvaged items and cost effective solutions to save their reno.

episodes.name: Andrew and Courtney
episodes.overview: Andrew is a single guy who loves to entertain family and friends, but his kitchen is too small and closed off. He wants open concept with a large island so he can see his guests when they come over, and have great sightlines to his seven nieces when they visit.  His sister Courtney agrees and has been by his side getting quotes, but they’re coming in too high. Andrew wants the biggest bang for his buck and doesn’t want to compromise. Sebastian and Sabrina dive into DIY with Andrew and Courtney, using salvaged items and unique finds to give Andrew the bachelor pad he’s always dreamed about.

episodes.name: Karen and Matt
episodes.overview: Karen and Matt crave an open concept main floor.  They have two young kids and a wall preventing them from proper sightlines. But the dividing wall is only the first of many ‘wants’ on their list. They want to overhaul their main floor so it looks more like an adult space, instead of a catch all for kids’ toys. Quotes for their dream reno are a nightmare, coming in well above their budget. Sebastian and Sabrina use their expertise and completely transform the space with upcycled materials and repurposed cabinetry to save their reno.

episodes.name: Jamie and Marcus
episodes.overview: Jamie and Marcus have a lot going on. They got engaged, bought a house, and now they want to take on a kitchen reno. Money is tight, but with broken drawers, doors that won’t fully open, and a hazardous stove, they’re desperate for a new kitchen. With a wedding around the corner, their funds are limited and quotes are coming in too high. But Sebastian and Sabrina know how to spend smart and reimagine design elements to save their reno.

episodes.name: Eric and Rebecca
episodes.overview: Eric and Rebecca are engineers by day, and home brewers by night. They love to have friends over to try new ales, but their 60s kitchen isn’t equipped for their entertaining needs.  They weren’t afraid to take out a wall in the dining room, but taking on a kitchen reno is beyond their engineering know-how. They want an open concept kitchen complete with beverage centre and won’t settle, but quotes are way over their budget. Sebastian and Sabrina recycle hardware and salvage materials to save their reno.

episodes.name: Jason and Nikki
episodes.overview: A busy family of four has a dysfunctional kitchen, and want to open it up

episodes.name: Lisa and Kenny
episodes.overview: A busy family has an unfinished kitchen

episodes.name: Raj and Riva
episodes.overview: Raj and Riva have a large family kitchen. But after 11 years, the brown cabinets, laminate counters and lack of organization, have them pushing the reno button.

episodes.name: Rob and Caitlin
episodes.overview: Rob and Caitlin have four kids and one on the way. When they moved into their family home, they personalized the kids’ rooms, but never completed their own bedroom and bathroom.

episodes.name: Brian and Lainie
episodes.overview: Brian and Lainie are a fun-loving couple with 5-year-old twin girls, but mealtime in their galley kitchen is anything but fun. Their narrow galley kitchen is simply too small. Just opening the fridge door creates a roadblock.

episodes.name: Ken and Elisa
episodes.overview: When Ken and Elisa purchased their family home, they knew it needed work. They did their research, found a contractor and began to renovate. Months later, the reno is incomplete and the contractor left them with both an unfinished basement and a hole in their wallet.

episodes.name: Elise & Michael
episodes.overview: Elise and former DJ turned family man Michael, are new parents living in a home of half-finished DIYs. Mike’s reno attempts have resulted in no ceiling, and a kitchen that doubles as a laundry room.

episodes.name: Erin & Richard
episodes.overview: Erin and Richard have three young kids and an outdated ‘70s split-level that needs some serious TLC. The main floor is a mess, with a fireplace hazard for their young ones and a bevy of half-finished projects.

episodes.name: Jenn & Phil
episodes.overview: Jenn and Phil are in DIY SOS! With Phil’s unfinished renovations, a family of raccoons in the chimney, and exterior doors that do not retain heat in the cold, the couple are getting desperate.

episodes.name: Kim & Kyle
episodes.overview: Newlyweds Kim and Kyle were happy to become new homeowners, but the fear of fixing their cold and cramped 100-year-old home brought a quick end to their honeymoon!

episodes.name: Nancy & Erick
episodes.overview: Board game enthusiasts, Nancy and Erick have two young children and an unfinished basement that hasn’t been used since they moved in.

episodes.name: Charlotte & Michael
episodes.overview: Charlotte’s best friend Michael finds it hilarious that Charlotte pulls out a plunger every time she needs to drain the sink. But Charlotte has had enough with her old, dated kitchen and knows it needs a major makeover.

episodes.name: Ashlea & Graeme
episodes.overview: Ashlea and Graeme would like to convert their cozy barn into a functional space for exercise, leisure, and work – the only problem is, they’re being told to tear it all down and start from scratch!

episodes.name: Raj & Nader
episodes.overview: Nadar and Raj are best friends who bought a house together in downtown Toronto. They love to cook and entertain their friends, but they hate the cramped, impractical kitchen with dated cabinets and lack of counter space.

episodes.name: Maria & Alex
episodes.overview: Maria and Alex have a bathroom that is stuck in the ‘80s, with unfashionable tile, a broken jacuzzi and a bidet. Maria is a professional makeup artist and needs an environment she can work in and be proud of.

episodes.name: Natalie & Adam
episodes.overview: Natalie is a professional hockey player, who along with her husband Adam, has always dreamed of having a personal gym. But right now the space is more like a storage locker in need of some serious organization.

episodes.name: Christine & Michel
episodes.overview: Christine and Michel have a beautiful home, but space is tight with a two year old, home office and a large extended family that use the basement as their own personal storage locker. Sab and Seb work together on the unfinished basement to create an inspiring home office and lounge area to relax in.

episodes.name: Melina & Emma
episodes.overview: Mother and stepdaughter Melina and Emma, are fed up with their outdated and busted up kitchen. With Emma’s father, and family cook, away on business, they want to surprise him with the kitchen of his dreams.

episodes.name: Mariana & Andy
episodes.overview: Marianna and Andy’s main floor has serious flow issues. Marianna craves a French bistro-inspired kitchen but feels isolated in the current cramped location.

episodes.name: Lauren & Amanda
episodes.overview: Lauren and Amanda have just finished renovating their new home, but haven’t touched the cramped and outdated basement. The clock is ticking as Lauren is eight weeks away from having their first baby.

episodes.name: Niamh & Doug
episodes.overview: Electrical issues are no joke and that’s just the tip of the iceberg for Niamh and Doug’s unfinished renovation.

episodes.name: Hannah & Daniel
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha take on a cramped, water logged basement. It's time to innovate and elevate this space into a cozy suite!

episodes.name: Leilani & Cheyenne
episodes.overview: With a baby on the way, Leilani needs her townhouse transformed yesterday. Samantha and Sebastian are going to deliver!

episodes.name: Jenn & Paul
episodes.overview: Jenn and Paul are in desperate need of a safe haven from their twin boys, but their third-floor former bed and breakfast is a complete mess. Sebastian and Samantha are here to clean it up!

episodes.name: David & Lynn
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha help mother-son combo David and Lynn transform his dingy dungeon of a basement into a party pad mom can be proud of.

episodes.name: Ryan & Nicoletta
episodes.overview: Ryan and Nicoletta need help with a divided space that’s begging for a new layout. Samantha and Sebastian are here to take this reno to school!

episodes.name: Shawna & Andrew
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha help mother-son combo David and Lynn transform his dingy dungeon of a basement into a party pad mom can be proud of.

episodes.name: Joyal & Eugene
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha transform Joyal and Eugene’s large but dated home from pallid to palatial.

episodes.name: Tessa & Eddie
episodes.overview: Sebastian’s friend Tessa and her husband Eddie need a full re-construction of their finished but dysfunctional basement.

episodes.name: Jennie & Michael
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha work to fix Jennie and Michael’s problem solarium - while transforming the kitchen it’s attached to.

episodes.name: Rose & Mike
episodes.overview: Rose and Mike dream of hosting large family dinners in a breezy, island inspired space, but right now it feels more like a tropical storm. Sebastian and Samantha create a configuration that will accommodate future gatherings, giving their new kitchen a warm and beachy feel.

episodes.name: Marie & Robert
episodes.overview: Robert wants to transform their basement, but Marie has witnessed a few renovation accidents in the past and needs the help of the professionals.

episodes.name: Davina & Phil
episodes.overview: Davina and Phil's home has become a hangout space for their friends and family, but it’s starting to get a little crowded - and the unused basement is the perfect canvas.

episodes.name: Catherine & Dan
episodes.overview: An older home with loads of problems has left Catherine and Dan with a tiny budget to renovate their narrow galley kitchen.

episodes.name: Linda & Christian
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha transform Linda and Christian's principal bedroom from dodgy motel to luxury hotel with a spa-inspired ensuite.

episodes.name: Justin & Randy
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha are challenged with giving a new look to an old home without losing the character.

episodes.name: Elektra & Paul
episodes.overview: Café owners Elektra and Paul ask for help with their home kitchen, much in need of an extra shot of Sebastian and Samantha’s expertise.

episodes.name: Courtlyn & Kim
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha help renovate a downstairs suite for a daughter who needs a little privacy from mom.

episodes.name: Lori & David
episodes.overview: After renovating their entire home, Lori and David have one room left on their checklist and they need Samantha and Sebastian's help to cross the finish line.

episodes.name: Maricris & Francis
episodes.overview: With a new baby on the way, Maricris and Francis have only six weeks to recreate their colourless main floor

episodes.name: Kristen & Alex
episodes.overview: A couple with conflicting schedules desperately need a solution to their poorly laid out main bedroom.

episodes.name: Melissa & Ben
episodes.overview: Melissa and Ben suffer a second floor with a host of problems, but their wants may be bigger than their budget.

episodes.name: Michelle & Fred
episodes.overview: Sebastian and Samantha use their magic touch to bring some love and warmth back into a family’s cluttered main floor.

episodes.name: Sue, Lee & Andy
episodes.overview: Self-professed renovation experts Lee and Andy try to give Sebastian a run for his money renovating their mother’s 1970’s style kitchen.
